data.title: Small meetings work great here & I love the coffee
data.text: My organization has small meetings (<9 people) at this coffee shop in the evening each month. I love their coffee (Bella Dolce) and several people get a salad or pastry prior to our meetings. We have never been disappointed. The baristas are very friendly and the owner always stops by our table to say hi. We've been going here for years and just love it.

data.title: Another great coffeehouse in Longmont!
data.text:
I really love stopping through downtown Longmont to grab coffee, because there are so many wonderful independent coffeehouses to choose from!

There are a couple I have yet to visit (mostly because I tend to stop at my favorites).  I decided to stop at La Vita Bella this morning to finally check them out.  

This is a great coffeehouse, lots of seating (indoors) and some outdoor seating as well.  Pastry case looked delicious, but I was only stopping for coffee today, but everything looked amazing.

My latte was very good (only a slight miss in that they didn't seem to add the "trace" vanilla I asked for).  It was fine since I like both with and without, but today was looking forward to a bit of flavor. 

That said, latte was still great, and I'd recommend as adding another great coffee house to your list if you haven't yet visited!

data.title: Coffee made with love
data.text: These people understand the secret to success is offering an exceptional product and making the customer happy.  If you don't like it (which I've never personally experienced), they'll fix you another one on them. Their eats are fresh, delicious, and locally made (many are made in-house).  The environment is mellow and relaxed. The bathrooms are very clean!

data.title: Disappointing
data.text: This shop has very good pastry and coffee cake but the chai was terrible. I tried the local blend and it had absolutely no flavor.

data.title: Yummy coffees!
data.text: This little coffee shop is a gem. The atmosphere is welcoming and their espresso drinks are excellent. Try one of the specialty mochas!

data.title: Best qualtiy coffee in Longmont!
data.text:
Longmont is a great town with many coffee options.  I for one have been to basically all of them.  As a avid espresso drinker, there are many styles also.  La Vita Bella, IMO, has the most unique, smoothest and richest espresso around.  Chris hand picked the combination of beans for their espresso, so it's unique, and unmatched.

In addition to the great coffee, all the treats are house made and FANTASTIC.  Their cinnamon rolls also, the best in town.  And yes, I have probably had every gourmet variety in the area :) 

The staff is friendly, personal, and knowledgeable, and the atmosphere is one of the best little spots in Longmont!  Give it a shot!

data.title: Homemade Cinnamon Buns...Any Other Questions?
data.text: Small, locally-owned coffee shop with pastries and sandwiches.  You have to take one short flight of stairs down because this cafe is a few feet below street level (which kinda adds to the ambiance).  A wheelchair would be somewhat difficult, but not impossible. Not sure what designer coffee they serve, but it is non-acidic, flavorful and delicious! Great array of specialty coffee drinks too!  But for us, the real reason to stop here are the homemade cinnamon buns.  They're simply delicious (and pretty darn big too).

data.title: Best Coffee Shop in Town
data.text: Best Coffee-Refreshing drinks and blueberry muffins in town. Good People ...Parking on 5th St. Nice Place to relax and good WIFI

data.title: Can't have too many good coffeehouses.
data.text: Good coffee house, conveniently located on Main St.,does require walking down a short flight of stairs.  Coffee is good, tasty looking sweets, and per the posters, there is live music at times.  Friendly staff and comfortable soft seating if you choose, regular chairs if you'd rather.

data.title: Great neighborhood coffee shop
data.text: We love stopping here for hot chocolate and pastry when we go through Longmont. Even though the hot chocolate can have a rather different (chai) taste, it still is quite good. The pastries are good, and the sofas for comfortable lounging make it a cozy spot.

data.title: Finally a coffeehouse open late!
data.text: If I wanted to go to bed at 8pm I wouldn't need coffee.  This place has delicious drinks and treats and it is open late enough for those that actually like to be out after 8pm...

data.title: Great little coffee house in Longmont!
data.text: We stumbled upon La Vita Bella one night while searching for good coffee after 8pm in Longmont (a challenging feat, to say the least!). What we found has brought us back time again. The barista was incredibly friendly and kind, the coffee was outstanding, and the ambiance is inviting and hip (not annoyingly hip like you might find in a certain, nearby college town...). This place is great...you need to go there!

data.title: Hidden gem for good coffee
data.text: We stopped in while walking down Main Street and had no idea what to expect. The service was phenomenal. The coffee was delicious. We had a mocha specialty coffee and it was perfect. We will be back.

data.title: Great coffee house!
data.text: I always intend to go back but never have time. However, the few times I was there I LOVED it. I really dig that is downstairs. Their tea selection is AMAZING and pretty decent coffee also! The barista was super nice and I could tell he liked doing his job. Very relaxed and accepting enviroment!

data.title: Best atmosphere. Friendliest staff. Rich cake.
data.text: These are the nicest people to every customer. Their drinks are classic yet orriginal. They have the best cakes. 1 slice for 3 people is enough.

data.title: Best coffee shop in Longmont
data.text: La Vita Bella has a killer combo featuring the best drinks in town coupled with the best pastries. I highly recommend their house brand of chai and cannot say enough about their cinnamon rolls.
